interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Country Strong
Review Date: 2019/05/09
Store: Gwyneth Paltrow  (Actor),     Tim McGraw  (Actor),     Shana Feste  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Soon after a rising young singer-songwriter (Garrett Hedlund) gets involved with a fallen, emotionally unstable country star (Gwyneth Paltrow), the pair embark on a career resurrection tour helmed by her husband/manager (Tim McGraw) and featuring a beauty queen-turned-singer (Leighton Meester). Between concerts, romantic entanglements and old demons threaten to derail them all.', 'Amazon.com', 'A Nashville superstar faces a crossroads in her life in the sweet, sentimental', 'Country Strong', ". While in rehab, Gwyneth Paltrow's six-time Grammy Award winner Kelly Canter has a fling with an admiring orderly, Beau (", 'Tron: Legacy', "'s Garrett Hedlund). An aspiring singer/songwriter, Beau tells Kelly's manager and husband, James (Tim McGraw, Hedlund's", 'Friday Night Lights', 'father), that he\'s her "sponsor." Anxious to revitalize her career, James checks Kelly out early to send her back on tour. He may love his wife, but he doesn\'t know when to stop pushing. When he hears Beau\'s duet with former beauty queen Chiles (', 'Gossip Girl', "'s Leighton Meester), he adds them to the bill. En route from Tennessee to Texas, Beau discovers that Chiles is more talented and intelligent than he thought, but he remains devoted to his mentor, even though he knows they have no future. When Kelly starts drinking again, Beau gravitates towards his more stable tour mate. Writer-director Shana Feste (", 'The Greatest', ") doesn't argue that love and work can't coexist, but rather that love and fame are incompatible. They certainly present a challenge, but it's a shaky thesis on which to build a film, especially when McGraw and Faith Hill, one of Paltrow's musical inspirations, serve as the exception that proves the rule. Consequently, the scenario falls apart by the final act, since someone has to suffer to illustrate Feste's point. Until then, the cast rises to the occasion, particularly Meester, who brings a breezy charm to an overly pessimistic premise.", '--Kathleen C. Fennessy']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Music, Drama, Romance', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Tim McGraw, Shana Feste, Gwyneth Paltrow', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 57 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.3 x 7.5 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'CTR37446DVD', 'Director': 'Shana Feste', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 57 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 12, 2011', 'Actors': 'Gwyneth Paltrow, Tim McGraw', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'French, English, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Sony', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: Great movie!
Review Title: Add to your collection
Rating: 5.0

reference_summary:
Country Strong
Gwyneth Paltrow  (Actor),     Tim McGraw  (Actor),     Shana Feste  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
['Product Description', 'Soon after a rising young singer-songwriter (Garrett Hedlund) gets involved with a fallen, emotionally unstable country star (Gwyneth Paltrow), the pair embark on a career resurrection tour helmed by her husband/manager (Tim McGraw) and featuring a beauty queen-turned-singer (Leighton Meester). Between concerts, romantic entanglements and old demons threaten to derail them all.', 'Amazon.com', 'A Nashville superstar faces a crossroads in her life in the sweet, sentimental', 'Country Strong', ". While in rehab, Gwyneth Paltrow's six-time Grammy Award winner Kelly Canter has a fling with an admiring orderly, Beau (", 'Tron: Legacy', "'s Garrett Hedlund). An aspiring singer/songwriter, Beau tells Kelly's manager and husband, James (Tim McGraw, Hedlund's", 'Friday Night Lights', 'father), that he\'s her "sponsor." Anxious to revitalize her career, James checks Kelly out early to send her back on tour. He may love his wife, but he doesn\'t know when to stop pushing. When he hears Beau\'s duet with former beauty queen Chiles (', 'Gossip Girl', "'s Leighton Meester), he adds them to the bill. En route from Tennessee to Texas, Beau discovers that Chiles is more talented and intelligent than he thought, but he remains devoted to his mentor, even though he knows they have no future. When Kelly starts drinking again, Beau gravitates towards his more stable tour mate. Writer-director Shana Feste (", 'The Greatest', ") doesn't argue that love and work can't coexist, but rather that love and fame are incompatible. They certainly present a challenge, but it's a shaky thesis on which to build a film, especially when McGraw and Faith Hill, one of Paltrow's musical inspirations, serve as the exception that proves the rule. Consequently, the scenario falls apart by the final act, since someone has to suffer to illustrate Feste's point. Until then, the cast rises to the occasion, particularly Meester, who brings a breezy charm to an overly pessimistic premise.", '--Kathleen C. Fennessy']

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Genre Preference:** The user enjoys Music, Drama, and Romance genres, particularly films that intertwine these elements.
  
- **Tone:** They gravitate toward narratives that explore emotional depth and personal relationships, often featuring themes of career struggle and romantic complexity.

- **Review Behavior:** The user provides positive feedback, suggesting they appreciate quality storytelling and character development, as indicated by their 5-star rating and enthusiastic comment.

- **Medium Engagement:** Preference for movies, particularly on DVD format, suggesting a liking for physical collections over digital.

- **Target Audience Awareness:** The user seems to resonate with works that feature well-known actors and directors, indicating a preference for established talent and production value.

- **Content Evaluation:** They appreciate films equipped with strong character arcs and emotional storytelling, as reflected in their favorable review of a film that discusses the intersections of love, fame, and personal trials.

Overall, this user exhibits a clear affection for emotionally rich, character-driven films that focus on music and romance, aligning their viewing preferences with powerful performances and engaging plots.
